chargeHist.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reduces cash bail from $15,000.00 to $5,000.00 cash. All other previous terms and conditions of bail are to remain.

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court, defendant Melissa P Calvert not in court, in custody. Court waives Defendant's appearance for this hearing.
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom video means. 
Case in court for bail bond hearing.  Bail motion by Defense argued and granted in part by the Court.  Bail set at $5,000.00 cash; all other previous terms and conditions of bail are to remain. Case remains calendared before branch 15. Court informs all parties that there will not be any more adjourned statuses.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification

Defendant Melissa P Calvert in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Defendant Melissa P Calvert in custody.  
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense requests trial dates and bail review. Court sets matter for Bail/Bond hearing and status before branch 15.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

Court reschedules status conference scheduled for 4-20-2022 to be heard before Br. 15, SB506 on April 25, 2022 at 8:45am. Counsel notified of new date and time via email. Defense to notify Defendant of new date and time.

Defendant Melissa P Calvert in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Melissa P Calvert in custody. Attorney Peirce appeared by video means.
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for arraignment. Filed, original information; copy served on Defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty. Discussions placed on the record. Defense filed a motion to withdraw. Court GRANTS Defense request. This Clerk will notify the Office of Public Defender of need for appointment of counsel for Defendant on this date. Case remains calendared before Br. 15 for status of counsel. Defendant may appear via Zoom for in person hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

MATTER HEARD OFF RECORD AND WITH COURT APPROVAL.
Arraignment scheduled for today has been RESCHEDULED. Arraignment will be conducted before branch 15 in SB506 on March 17, 2022 at 8:45am.
Received and Filed. Letter re: limited-scope engagement
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Melissa P Calvert in court with Attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Melissa P Calvert in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. State requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melissa P Calvert in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
